intro: Gamochaeta peregrina, commonly known as the wandering bluemink, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Gamochaeta peregrina is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of wetland ecosystems.
